Join the team

We believe that results become more effective when every member of the team trusts in our values. This is more important than competences. Driven by our values, we integrate engineering excellence with our values that drive our business and approach to relationships: hurdworking, trust, consistent approaches, love to learn, help industry, think outside of the box. We trust in Rust.

Value

Work hard

  • Work hard
  • Trust
  • Consistent approaches
  • Love to learn
  • Help industry and society
  • Think outside of the box

# Work hard and do our best on 150%

**We believe that hardworking is one of the most important value in our employees. With hard work and effort, you can achieve anything.**

  • - We enjoy finding a balance between family and work without compromising business.
  • - We love the *discipline*, the *trade-off* we're used to have a result.
  • - Hard work is an essential element in tracking down and *perfecting a strategy* and in executing it.
  • - Hard work spotlights the character of people: some turn up their sleeves, some turn up their noses, and some don’t turn up at all.

# Trust each other and the customer

** Trust is the glue of life. It’s the most essential ingredient in effective communication. It’s the foundational principle that holds all relationships.**

  • - When trust is LOW the speed of doing business slows down and the cost goes up.
  • - When trust is HIGH the speed of doing business accelerates and the cost falls.
  • - Trust must be based on transparency.

# Stick to consistent approaches

** Consistency brings order, which helps regularly achieve company objectives. **

  • - We use coding best practices to help improve quality of our products.
  • - We use Test-driven development principle.
  • - We use the best tools to solve problems.

# Love to learn and share knowledge with each other and with society

** We create connections between knowledge and people.**

  • - Members of our team organize and participate in educational initiatives such as workshops, webinars etc.
  • - Our online community helps developers grow together and find answers to even the most difficult questions in the area.
  • - Learning to code not only allows you to give machines instructions, but it also teaches you abstract thinking and problem-solving.

# Help industry and society when we can do it

** Developers have an outsize impact on the society because so much of our world is automated.**

  • - Help in getting interaction between people and machines.
  • - Make hard things easy.
  • - Іdeas implemented by developers improve the life of society.

# Think outside of the box

** We use first-principles thinking. That it’s one of the best ways to break down complicated problems into basic elements and then reassemble them from the ground up. It helps us learn to think for ourselves and unlock our creative potential. **

  • - Reasoning by first principles removes the impurity of assumptions and conventions.
  • - To understand is to know what to do.
  • - Disassemble the house to the last brick and you will know how to assemble it back.

Current Openings

If you don't see a fit below, feel free to drop us a line at aply@obox.systems

Rust Systems Developer

Full-time, remote

FAQ

  • Where is Out of the Box Systems located?
    Out of the Box Systems has a corps of folks in Ukraine, but all of the company is remote.
  • Are you okay with remote employment?
    Yes! We grow the team and we expect the team to be remote.
  • What is work/life balance like at Out of the Box Systems?
    We take work seriously. Work is important to us. But at the same time, we understand that family is more important than work. Also we appreciate the free time of our workers and expect that everyone has a life outside work.
  • What do you look for in candidates?
    Every position in our team is unique. Therefore, if you want to get acquainted with the requirements for the candidate, you can read it in the job description. If you are looking for a job for a month or two, then you are not up to us. We are focused on long-term cooperation.
  • How does the employment process take place?
    Here you are our core steps of the employment process: If you have relevant experience, you will be able to pass:
    • - Technical task (in the form of the test)
    • - Non-technical interview
    • - Technical interview
    • - Probationary period: 1-1.5 months
    • - The main work
  • Is it possible to try to pass the test a second time?
    Yes, you can retake the test in a month. If you have improved your knowledge and are confident in your technical skills, you will be able to take the test again.
  • How can I prepare for the test?
    Be as transparent as humanly possible.Be yourself, soberly assess your capabilities, answer openly. Also we recommend that you review the list of learning materials 📚 for mastering RUST
  • What benefits do you have?
    We can give you the fast growth of knowledge and practical skills, consistent salary growth, skills on how to be productive, help with learning and advancing in your career. You’ll get a reliable long-term remote job, regular feedback on your work. With us you’ll get the opportunity to become part of the global economy and get independence from the local market.
  • Are you open to bringing on interns?
    We are open to sharing knowledge. So you can get into a mentoring program. We also value our time, so you get into this program after testing your skills and passing a non-technical interview. These steps will help us understand the seriousness of your intentions.
